definition: to rest weapons and loosen armor (idiom); to relax from fighting
to bind/bunch/bundle/classifier for bunches, bundles, beams of light etc/to control

first of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/(used for an unspecified person or thing)/first (in a list, as a party to a contract etc)/letter "A" or roman "I" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/armor plating/shell or carapace/(of the fingers or toes) nail/bladed leather or metal armor (old)/ranking system used in the Imperial examinations (old)/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)/ancient Chinese compass point: 75°
that being the case/then/in that case
minister not afraid to give forthright criticism
precarious as morning dew (idiom); unlikely to last out the day
classical final particle, similar to modern 了[le5]
to stand on tiptoe and crane one's neck (idiom); fig. to yearn for sth
old variant of 愷|恺[kai3]/old variant of 凱|凯[kai3]
Ma Fuzi (-260 BC), hapless general of Zhao 趙國|赵国, who famously led an army of 400,000 to total annihilation at battle of Changping 長平之戰|长平之战 in 260 BC/also called Zhao Kuo 趙括|赵括
war on all sides (idiom); fighting from all four quarters
